lines.text: All people know the same truth. Our lives consist of how we chose to distort it.
Tradition is the illusion of permanence.
You have no values. Your whole life, it's nihilism, it's cynicism, it's sarcasm and your orgasm.
You know in France, I could run on that slogan and win.
[Talking about life]
It's like Vegas. You're up, you're down, but in the end the house always wins. Doesn't mean you didn't have fun.
You know, I cannot understand why the most sophisticated of women can't tell the difference between a meaningless, hot, passionate sexual affair and a nice, solid, tranquil, routine marriage.

[breaking down]
Tell me, Harry, just tell me something. Was she the only one, or were there others?
No, Amy Pollock was the only one, may God strike me dead if I am lying.
You're an atheist, Harry!
Wha-hey, we're alone in the universe, you're going to blame that on me, too?

[angrily tears papers from typewriter]
Stop your tap-dancing...
Does the president think of fucking every woman he meets? Oh sorry, bad example.
Do you care even about the holocaust, or do you think it never happened?
Not only do I know that we lost 6 million, but the scary thing is that records are made to be broken
It's tradition.
Tradition is the illusion of permanence.
Cookie, do you know what a black hole is?
Sure, that's how I make my livin'!

[to a suffering damned soul in Hell]
What did you do?
I invented aluminum siding.
The most important words in the English language are not "I love you" but "It's benign."
So now you're blaming me because I don't go out with you enough, to meet strangers to FUCK!

[to his brother-in-law Bert]
I think you're the opposite of a paranoid. I think you go around with the insane delusion that people like you.
I'm a Jew. I don't believe in Heaven.
Where do you want to go?
A Chinese restaurant.
You're air-conditioned here?
Sure! Fucks up the ozone layer.
Between air conditioning and the Pope, I chose air conditioning.
Every hooker I ever speak to tells me that it beats the hell out of waitressing. Waitressing's gotta be the worst fucking job in the world.
All people know the same truth. Our lives consist of how we choose to distort it.

[Unaware that Leslie is fellating Ken because she is blind]
Boy, you must really love onions!
I'm a guy who can't function well in life but can in art.
Six shrinks later, three wives down the line, and I still can't get my life together.
The ironic thing is that the school that kicked me out is honoring me soon.
Why did they kick you out?
Because I wasn't interested in college. I wanted to be a writer and that's all I cared about. Also, I tried to give the Dean's wife an enema. They didn't take kindly to that.

[to his brother-in-law]
I don't think you're a paranoid. I think you're the opposite of a paranoid. I think you go around with the insane delusion that everybody likes you!
The two most important things are the work that you choose and sex.
You take everyone's suffering and turn it into gold, LITERARY GOLD!
How come you got all this money?
I always keep hooker money around, you know, 'cause I once paid by check years ago and the I.R.S. killed me.

[carping on Harry]
He's betting everything on physics and pussy.
Look, I was merely explaining to you why my choice of necessity is confined to your practice.
Cookie is the nanny.
The nanny! Where did you get her, from an agency or a massage parlor?
Oh jesus! She's a sweet kid, what are you picking on?
Ah, still with the sex pots, the tramps, the vilda chayes.
Ah, she's got a PhD, this girl.
Really? I don't know how she did on her written, but I'm sure she got an A plus on her oral exam.
You schmuck, you bastard. I'd like to cut your fuckin' head off.
You're upset, right?
[Therapist Joan is trying to counsel Mr. Farber but has just learned that her husband, Harry, has had an affair with a patient of hers]

I've been - I've been losing sleep at night. I can't shut my eyes at night. I - I think I should quit my job. But I can't bring myself to do it. Maybe because my brother-in-law treats me kindly. But - but working for him is taking its toll on me emotionally.
Could you excuse me, Mr. Farber?
[gets up and leaves the room]
What?

[from offscreen]
You fuck-dumb fuck! I can't believe you fucking did this! You fucking asshole. You fucked my patient? Harry, you don't fuck somebody's patient. Fuck you!
[she returns]
Continue, Mr. Farber.
[Mr. Farber is lying on a patient's couch waiting for his therapist, Joan, to return from dressing down her husband, Harry, for having an affair]

[from offscreen]
I want you to get your shit. And I want you to get your goddamn clothes, and I want you to get the fuck outta here. You are the most fucking irresponsible person I've ever seen in my entire life! Get out!
[she returns]
Continue, Mr. Farber.

[very uncomfortable]
D-Doctor...

[not bothering to leave the room this time]
And I mean tonight, motherfucker!
[bursts into tears]
You ever fuck a blind girl?
No. That I never did.
Oh, they're so grateful.
Between air-conditioning and the Pope, I'll take air-conditioning.

[after sex]
Cookie, you're a definite artist. They should put your lips in the Smithsonian.
You love baseball.
Baseball's easy because it has rules. It has foul lines.

[to Fay]
I'm single, available, with the soul of a black man.
Can I be honored and then arrested?
This guy is too old for her.
He's younger than you are.
Hey, I'm much too old for her, it's ridiculous. But, because of my immaturity I have a boyish quality that works.
You're a self-hating jew.
Hey, I may hate myself but not 'cause I'm jewish.
Wolf Fishbein said, in order to hide the bodies, you ate them!
So, what are you making a fuss? Some bury, some burn, I ate!
You can't bullshit me like your shrink, he only knows what you tell him.
You never forgave him because you thought he was a bad father.
He was!
Thanks for stopping by...
